dependencies.description:
fplll contains implementations of several lattice algorithms. The
implementation relies on floating-point orthogonalization, and LLL is
central to the code, hence the name.
dependencies.name: fplll

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
GMP is a free library for arbitrary precision arithmetic, operating on
signed integers, rational numbers, and floating-point numbers.
dependencies.name: gmp

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.
dependencies.name: libxml2

dependencies.description: Library for arbitrary precision interval arithmetic based on MPFR
dependencies.name: mpfi

dependencies.description:
The MPFR library is a C library for multiple-precision floating-point
computations with correct rounding.
dependencies.name: mpfr

dependent_to.description: Python wrapper for the Sollya library
dependent_to.name: py-pythonsollya

description:
Sollya is both a tool environment and a library for safe floating-point
code development. It is particularily targeted to the automatized
implementation of mathematical floating-point libraries (libm). Amongst
other features, it offers a certified infinity (supremum) norm and a
fast Remez algorithm.
name: sollya

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
